Header.Name: WebLichtWebService
Header.Description: This is a core model which can be used as a basis for web service registry specific models. In principle this profile shouldn't be instantiated, instead new profiles can be created which extend the structure built by the components in this profile. Valid instantiations of these extensions allow validation of the core elements against the schema of this profile. More detailed information, including facilities to validate compliance with this core model, can be found at: https://lux17.mpi.nl/isocat/clarin/ws/cmd-core/index.html

CMD_Element.name: Name
CMD_Element.Documentation: The name of the web service or set of web services.

CMD_Element.name: Description
CMD_Element.Documentation: A description of the web service or set of web services.

CMD_Element.name: Name
CMD_Element.Documentation: This Operation Name should be resolvable in the Service ServiceDescription, i.e., the WSDL or WADL document describing how to technically invoke the service.

CMD_Element.name: Description
CMD_Element.Documentation: The Operation Description should describe what this operation does to the input to produce the output.

CMD_Element.name: Name
CMD_Element.Documentation: This ParameterGroup Name should in general be resolvable in the Service ServiceDescription, i.e., the WSDL or WADL document describing how to technically invoke the service.

CMD_Element.name: Description
CMD_Element.Documentation: Describes the role of this ParameterGroup for this web service operation.

CMD_Element.name: MIMEType
CMD_Element.Documentation: The MIME type of this ParameterGroup, which indicates that its one input resource containing several input Parameters.

CMD_Element.name: DataType
CMD_Element.Documentation: The data type of this ParameterGroup.

CMD_Element.name: DataCategory
CMD_Element.Documentation: The PID refering to the (ISOcat) data category specifying this ParameterGroup.

CMD_Element.name: SemanticType
CMD_Element.Documentation: A type describing the semantics of this parameter in its context. For example, an input parameter might be an WS specific project name, given to a project created by an earlier WS call. In that case the name of the parameter might be 'project', its data type might be 'xsd:string', its data category /projectName/ and its semantic type 'myWSApp.project'.

CMD_Element.name: Name
CMD_Element.Documentation: This Parameter Name, unless the Parameter is part of a ParameterGroup, should be resolvable in the Service ServiceDescription, , i.e., the WSDL or WADL document describing how to technically invoke the service.

CMD_Element.name: Description
CMD_Element.Documentation: Describes the role of this Parameter for this web service operation.

CMD_Element.name: MIMEType
CMD_Element.Documentation: The MIME type of this Parameter, which indicates that its an input resource on its own.

CMD_Element.name: DataType
CMD_Element.Documentation: The data type of this Parameter. In general this should be an XSD data type, e.g., xsd:string or xsd:anyURI.

CMD_Element.name: isConfigurationParameter
CMD_Element.Documentation: Set this flag to true if the parameter configures the operation of the web services, which is something else then the input the operation works upon. For example, the input of an operation can be a series of sensor values while a configuration parameter might be a treshhold or a weight used in the calculation done on this sensor values.

CMD_Element.name: DataCategory
CMD_Element.Documentation: The PID refering to the (ISOcat) data category specifying this Parameter.

CMD_Element.name: SemanticType
CMD_Element.Documentation: A type describing the semantics of this parameter in its context. For example, an input parameter might be an WS specific project name, given to a project created by an earlier WS call. In that case the name of the parameter might be 'project', its data type might be 'xsd:string', its data category /projectName/ and its semantic type 'myWSApp.project'.

CMD_Element.name: Value
CMD_Element.Documentation: A possible literal value of a parameter.

CMD_Element.name: Description
CMD_Element.Documentation: A description of the meaning of a possible literal value of a parameter.

CMD_Element.name: DataCategory
CMD_Element.Documentation: The PID refering to the (ISOcat) data category specifying this Parameter Value.
